channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Efficient Sharpness-aware Minimization for Molecular Graph Transformer Models
item.description: Sharpness-aware minimization (SAM) has received increasing attention in computer vision since it can effectively eliminate the sharp local minima from the training trajectory and mitigate generalization degradation.

item.title: Optimizing Hand Region Detection in MediaPipe Holistic Full-Body Pose Estimation to Improve Accuracy and Avoid Downstream Errors
item.description: This paper addresses a critical flaw in MediaPipe Holistic's hand Region of Interest (ROI) prediction, which struggles with non-ideal hand orientations, affecting sign language recognition accuracy.

item.title: Exploring Frequencies via Feature Mixing and Meta-Learning for Improving Adversarial Transferability
item.description: In the meta-train step, we leverage the low-frequency components of adversarial samples to boost the transferability of attacks against defense models.

item.title: RepVGG-GELAN: Enhanced GELAN with VGG-STYLE ConvNets for Brain Tumour Detection
item.description: This study proposes RepVGG-GELAN, a novel YOLO architecture enhanced with RepVGG, a reparameterized convolutional approach for object detection tasks particularly focusing on brain tumour detection within medical images.

item.title: 3D LiDAR Mapping in Dynamic Environments Using a 4D Implicit Neural Representation
item.description: We propose a novel approach for building accurate maps of dynamic environments utilizing a sequence of LiDAR scans.

item.title: AniTalker: Animate Vivid and Diverse Talking Faces through Identity-Decoupled Facial Motion Encoding
item.description: The paper introduces AniTalker, an innovative framework designed to generate lifelike talking faces from a single portrait.

item.title: Is Sora a World Simulator? A Comprehensive Survey on General World Models and Beyond
item.description: General world models represent a crucial pathway toward achieving Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), serving as the cornerstone for various applications ranging from virtual environments to decision-making systems.

item.title: Anchored Answers: Unravelling Positional Bias in GPT-2's Multiple-Choice Questions
item.description: By updating these vectors within MLP and recalibrating attention patterns to neutralise the preference for the first choice 'A', we effectively mitigate the anchored bias.

item.title: MedDoc-Bot: A Chat Tool for Comparative Analysis of Large Language Models in the Context of the Pediatric Hypertension Guideline
item.description: A pediatric expert provides a benchmark for evaluation by formulating questions and responses extracted from the ESC guidelines.

item.title: Classification of Breast Cancer Histopathology Images using a Modified Supervised Contrastive Learning Method
item.description: Deep neural networks have reached remarkable achievements in medical image processing tasks, specifically classifying and detecting various diseases.

item.title: CCDM: Continuous Conditional Diffusion Models for Image Generation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Continuous Conditional Diffusion Models (CCDMs), the first CDM designed specifically for the CCGM task.

item.title: PTQ4SAM: Post-Training Quantization for Segment Anything
item.description: We analyze its characteristics from both per-tensor and per-channel perspectives, and propose a Bimodal Integration strategy, which utilizes a mathematically equivalent sign operation to transform the bimodal distribution into a relatively easy-quantized normal distribution offline.

item.title: ReCycle: Fast and Efficient Long Time Series Forecasting with Residual Cyclic Transformers
item.description: ReCycle utilizes primary cycle compression to address the computational complexity of the attention mechanism in long time series.

item.title: CityLLaVA: Efficient Fine-Tuning for VLMs in City Scenario
item.description: In the vast and dynamic landscape of urban settings, Traffic Safety Description and Analysis plays a pivotal role in applications ranging from insurance inspection to accident prevention.

item.title: Vector Quantization for Recommender Systems: A Review and Outlook
item.description: Finally, the survey analyzes the remaining challenges and anticipates future trends in VQ4Rec, including the challenges associated with the training of vector quantization, the opportunities presented by large language models, and emerging trends in multimodal recommender systems.

item.title: LGTM: Local-to-Global Text-Driven Human Motion Diffusion Model
item.description: In this paper, we introduce LGTM, a novel Local-to-Global pipeline for Text-to-Motion generation.

item.title: Braced Fourier Continuation and Regression for Anomaly Detection
item.description: The Braced Fourier Continuation (BFC) and BFCR algorithms are first outlined, followed by a discussion of the properties of BFCR as well as demonstrations of how BFCR trend lines may be used effectively for anomaly detection both within and at the edges of arbitrary one-dimensional data sets.

item.title: TF4CTR: Twin Focus Framework for CTR Prediction via Adaptive Sample Differentiation
item.description: Specifically, the framework employs the SSEM at the bottom of the model to differentiate between samples, thereby assigning a more suitable encoder for each sample.

item.title: NegativePrompt: Leveraging Psychology for Large Language Models Enhancement via Negative Emotional Stimuli
item.description: The results are revealing: NegativePrompt markedly enhances the performance of LLMs, evidenced by relative improvements of 12. 89% in Instruction Induction tasks and 46. 25% in BIG-Bench tasks.

item.title: You Only Need Half: Boosting Data Augmentation by Using Partial Content
item.description: We propose a novel data augmentation method termed You Only Need hAlf (YONA), which simplifies the augmentation process.

item.title: Kinematic analysis of structural mechanics based on convolutional neural network
item.description: Convolutional neural network has certain practical value in the field of kinematic analysis of structural mechanics.

item.title: iSEARLE: Improving Textual Inversion for Zero-Shot Composed Image Retrieval
item.description: Given a query consisting of a reference image and a relative caption, Composed Image Retrieval (CIR) aims to retrieve target images visually similar to the reference one while incorporating the changes specified in the relative caption.

item.title: Performance Evaluation of Real-Time Object Detection for Electric Scooters
item.description: Electric scooters (e-scooters) have rapidly emerged as a popular mode of transportation in urban areas, yet they pose significant safety challenges.

item.title: HuixiangDou-CR: Coreference Resolution in Group Chats
item.description: How to eliminate pronominal reference in group chats?

item.title: DVMSR: Distillated Vision Mamba for Efficient Super-Resolution
item.description: Efficient Image Super-Resolution (SR) aims to accelerate SR network inference by minimizing computational complexity and network parameters while preserving performance.

item.title: Mozart's Touch: A Lightweight Multi-modal Music Generation Framework Based on Pre-Trained Large Models
item.description: In recent years, AI-Generated Content (AIGC) has witnessed rapid advancements, facilitating the generation of music, images, and other forms of artistic expression across various industries.

item.title: Adapting to Distribution Shift by Visual Domain Prompt Generation
item.description: In this work, we propose an approach on top of the pre-computed features of the foundation model.

item.title: Revisiting a Pain in the Neck: Semantic Phrase Processing Benchmark for Language Models
item.description: We introduce LexBench, a comprehensive evaluation suite enabled to test language models (LMs) on ten semantic phrase processing tasks.

item.title: ImageInWords: Unlocking Hyper-Detailed Image Descriptions
item.description: To address these issues, we introduce ImageInWords (IIW), a carefully designed human-in-the-loop annotation framework for curating hyper-detailed image descriptions and a new dataset resulting from this process.

item.title: Vision-based 3D occupancy prediction in autonomous driving: a review and outlook
item.description: In recent years, autonomous driving has garnered escalating attention for its potential to relieve drivers' burdens and improve driving safety.

item.title: Stationary Representations: Optimally Approximating Compatibility and Implications for Improved Model Replacements
item.description: This is particularly relevant in search and retrieval systems where it is crucial to avoid reprocessing of the gallery images with the updated model.

item.title: UnSAMFlow: Unsupervised Optical Flow Guided by Segment Anything Model
item.description: Traditional unsupervised optical flow methods are vulnerable to occlusions and motion boundaries due to lack of object-level information.

item.title: AFter: Attention-based Fusion Router for RGBT Tracking
item.description: In particular, we design a fusion structure space based on the hierarchical attention network, each attention-based fusion unit corresponding to a fusion operation and a combination of these attention units corresponding to a fusion structure.

item.title: Enhancing Cooperation through Selective Interaction and Long-term Experiences in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The significance of network structures in promoting group cooperation within social dilemmas has been widely recognized.

item.title: Hand-Object Interaction Controller (HOIC): Deep Reinforcement Learning for Reconstructing Interactions with Physics
item.description: Hand manipulating objects is an important interaction motion in our daily activities.

item.title: Semi-supervised Symmetric Matrix Factorization with Low-Rank Tensor Representation
item.description: To this end, we first propose a novel semi-supervised SNMF model by seeking low-rank representation for the tensor synthesized by the pairwise constraint matrix and a similarity matrix obtained by the product of the embedding matrix and its transpose, which could strengthen those two matrices simultaneously from a global perspective.

item.title: Enhancing Contextual Understanding in Large Language Models through Contrastive Decoding
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) tend to inadequately integrate input context during text generation, relying excessively on encoded prior knowledge in model parameters, potentially resulting in generated text with factual inconsistencies or contextually unfaithful content.

item.title: Deep Image Restoration For Image Anti-Forensics
item.description: Separate image forensics methods have also been developed to detect these traces.

item.title: Stabilizing Backpropagation Through Time to Learn Complex Physics
item.description: Of all the vector fields surrounding the minima of recurrent learning setups, the gradient field with its exploding and vanishing updates appears a poor choice for optimization, offering little beyond efficient computability.

item.title: A Survey of Time Series Foundation Models: Generalizing Time Series Representation with Large Language Mode
item.description: There are two main research lines, namely \textbf{pre-training foundation models from scratch for time series} and \textbf{adapting large language foundation models for time series}.

item.title: Auto-Encoding Morph-Tokens for Multimodal LLM
item.description: For multimodal LLMs, the synergy of visual comprehension (textual output) and generation (visual output) presents an ongoing challenge.

item.title: Vibe-Eval: A hard evaluation suite for measuring progress of multimodal language models
item.description: We introduce Vibe-Eval: a new open benchmark and framework for evaluating multimodal chat models.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning control strategies for Electric Vehicles and Renewable energy sources Virtual Power Plants
item.description: This research on Reinforcement Learning control strategies for Electric Vehicles and Renewable energy sources Virtual Power Plants focuses on providing solutions for such energy supply optimization models.

item.title: ProFLingo: A Fingerprinting-based Copyright Protection Scheme for Large Language Models
item.description: Our scheme checks the effectiveness of these adversarial examples on a suspect model to determine whether it has been derived from the original model.

item.title: Neural Context Flows for Learning Generalizable Dynamical Systems
item.description: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations typically struggle to generalize to new dynamical behaviors created by parameter changes in the underlying system, even when the dynamics are close to previously seen behaviors.

item.title: SlotGAT: Slot-based Message Passing for Heterogeneous Graph Neural Network
item.description: We identify a potential semantic mixing issue in existing message passing processes, where the representations of the neighbors of a node $v$ are forced to be transformed to the feature space of $v$ for aggregation, though the neighbors are in different types.

item.title: From Attack to Defense: Insights into Deep Learning Security Measures in Black-Box Settings
item.description: Using various datasets such as ImageNet-1000, CIFAR-100, and CIFAR-10 are used to evaluate the black-box attacks.

item.title: Improving Concept Alignment in Vision-Language Concept Bottleneck Models
item.description: Concept Bottleneck Models (CBM) map the input image to a high-level human-understandable concept space and then make class predictions based on these concepts.

item.title: CVTGAD: Simplified Transformer with Cross-View Attention for Unsupervised Graph-level Anomaly Detection
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Simplified Transformer with Cross-View Attention for Unsupervised Graph-level Anomaly Detection, namely, CVTGAD.

item.title: Advanced Detection of Source Code Clones via an Ensemble of Unsupervised Similarity Measures
item.description: The capability of accurately determining code similarity is crucial in many tasks related to software development.
